cui_name: Acute myeloid leukemia with t(8;16)(p11;p13) translocation
reasoning: AML with t(8;16) translocation is a rare cytogenetic subtype of AML, typically monocytic differentiation (FAB M5). Represents ~1-2% of all AML cases. Global AML incidence ~3-4 per 100k (adults); t(8;16) subset incidence approximately 0.15 per 100k. WHO/FISH classified genetic subtype with distinct clinical/prognostic features.
source: Grimwade D et al. (2010). Refinement of cytogenetic classification in acute myeloid leukemia. Blood. 116(3):354-365
